resources.string: Neiva is the capital of Huila\n\nIt is full of traditions and beautiful to tour surrounding areas, in addition to the hospitality that characterizes the Opitas. Because of this, you can enjoy a very pleasant holiday.

According to figures from DANE, in the census of 2005.

The city had a population of 315,332 people, with a density of about 289.7 people per square kilometer, a projection for 2015 estimated population of 344,242. \ n
Of the total, 324,440 people live in the municipal head and 19,802 in rural areas.

The 47.7% were men and 52.3% women.
\ nApproximately 70.2% of households in Neiva has 4 or fewer people. 

 The 8.4% of the population aged 5 and older currently residing in this county from another municipality and 0.1% in another country.

Neiva is a city in the process of growth and development, offering varied tourist alternatives presence of elements of cultural and historical type, in an interesting journey through the traditions and remnants of the past that are alive in everyday expressions and locations the city.

There are also several options to enjoy the nightlife in clubs, discos, restaurants and hotels.\n\nSectors Malecon, and La Toma Quirinal where different environments, musical styles and culinary offerings that are pleasing to enjoy themselves are identified and visitors.
Ethnography: According to figures from DANE on the 2005 census, the Ethnographic composition of the municipality is:
Mestizos and whites: 98.9% \nNative 0.3% \nblack, mulatto, Afro-Colombian or of African descent 0.8%

This monument dates from the seventeenth century. For many years he provided the service Neiva Cathedral. It has suffered the wrath of several earthquakes; It has been restored several times, but so far, retains its brick floors roast, tiers of monoliths, rammed earth walls and ceiling of roundwood.

It consists of three cylindrical shapes figures with heads of horses, wearing the colors of the flag of the country. The structure is made of iron, plastic heads, polyester reinforced with fiberglass; on the sculpture he was applied synthetic exterior paint, has a height of eight meters.
